dependencies.description: The PyPA recommended tool for installing Python packages.
dependencies.name: py-pip

dependencies.description:
A Python utility that aids in the process of downloading, building,
upgrading, installing, and uninstalling Python packages.
dependencies.name: py-setuptools

dependencies.description: A Spack managed Python virtual environment
dependencies.name: python-venv

dependent_to.description: A tool for static C/C++ code analysis.
dependent_to.name: cppcheck

dependent_to.description:
The Global Extensible Open Power Manager (GEOPM) Runtime is designed to
enhance energy efficiency of applications through active hardware
configuration.
dependent_to.name: geopm-runtime

dependent_to.description:
The Global Extensible Open Power Manager (GEOPM) Service provides a user
interface for accessing hardware telemetry and settings securely. Note:
GEOPM interfaces with hardware using Model Specific Registers (MSRs).
For proper usage make sure MSRs are made available via the msr or msr-
safe kernel modules by your administrator.
dependent_to.name: geopm-service

dependent_to.description:
GtkDoc is a tool used to extract API documentation from C-code like
Doxygen, but handles documentation of GObject (including signals and
properties) that makes it very suitable for GTK+ apps and libraries. It
uses docbook for intermediate files and can produce html by default and
pdf/man-pages with some extra work.
dependent_to.name: gtk-doc

dependent_to.description: Modern, user-friendly command-line HTTP client for the API era.
dependent_to.name: httpie

dependent_to.description: Libcroco is a standalone css2 parsing and manipulation library.
dependent_to.name: libcroco

dependent_to.description: Mercurial is a free, distributed source control management tool.
dependent_to.name: mercurial

dependent_to.description:
This package includes a collection of accessible themes for pygments
based on different sources.
dependent_to.name: py-accessible-pygments

dependent_to.description:
This is an extension to reStructuredText and Sphinx to be able to read
and render the Doxygen xml output.
dependent_to.name: py-breathe

dependent_to.description: Automatically color Python's uncaught exception tracebacks.
dependent_to.name: py-colored-traceback

dependent_to.description: Conan C/C++ package manager
dependent_to.name: py-conan

dependent_to.description: Tools to expand Python's enum module.
dependent_to.name: py-enum-tools

dependent_to.description:
FORD, standing for FORtran Documenter, is an automatic documentation
generator for modern Fortran programs.
dependent_to.name: py-ford

dependent_to.description: A clean customisable Sphinx documentation theme..
dependent_to.name: py-furo

dependent_to.description:
Gcovr provides a utility for managing the use of the GNU gcov utility
and generating summarized code coverage results. This command is
inspired by the Python coverage.py package, which provides a similar
utility for Python.
dependent_to.name: py-gcovr

dependent_to.description: gdbgui is a modern, free, browser-based frontend to gdb
dependent_to.name: py-gdbgui

dependent_to.description:
Python library for easily interacting with trained machine learning
models
dependent_to.name: py-gradio

dependent_to.description: Shell-like environment for HDF5.
dependent_to.name: py-h5sh

dependent_to.description:
IPython provides a rich toolkit to help you make the most out of using
Python interactively.
dependent_to.name: py-ipython

dependent_to.description: Jupyter Terminal Console
dependent_to.name: py-jupyter-console

dependent_to.description: Pygments theme using JupyterLab CSS variables.
dependent_to.name: py-jupyterlab-pygments

dependent_to.description: A Command-Line Interface framework.
dependent_to.name: py-knack

dependent_to.description: Mayavi: 3D visualization of scientific data in Python.
dependent_to.name: py-mayavi

dependent_to.description: metrics for Python, C, C++, Go and Javascript code
dependent_to.name: py-metrics

dependent_to.description: Use Jupyter in mkdocs websites.
dependent_to.name: py-mkdocs-jupyter

dependent_to.description:
Write your documentation in Markdown and create a professional static
site for your Open Source or commercial project in minutes.
dependent_to.name: py-mkdocs-material

dependent_to.description: Jupyter Notebook Conversion
dependent_to.name: py-nbconvert

dependent_to.description: Diff and merge of Jupyter Notebooks
dependent_to.name: py-nbdime

dependent_to.description: Pytest plugin for testing notebooks.
dependent_to.name: py-nbmake

dependent_to.description: Documentation generator for C++
dependent_to.name: py-poxy

dependent_to.description: Full-screen console debugger for Python
dependent_to.name: py-pudb

dependent_to.description:
Py2neo is a client library and toolkit for working with Neo4j from
within Python applications and from the command line.
dependent_to.name: py-py2neo

dependent_to.description:
A clean, three-column, Bootstrap-based Sphinx theme by and for the
PyData community.
dependent_to.name: py-pydata-sphinx-theme

dependent_to.description:
The pyface project contains a toolkit-independent GUI abstraction layer,
which is used to support the "visualization" features of the Traits
package. Thus, you can write code in terms of the Traits API (views,
items, editors, etc.), and let pyface and your selected toolkit and
back-end take care of the details of displaying them.
dependent_to.name: py-pyface

dependent_to.description: Jupyter Qt console
dependent_to.name: py-qtconsole

dependent_to.description:
readme_renderer is a library for rendering "readme" descriptions for
Warehouse.
dependent_to.name: py-readme-renderer

dependent_to.description:
Rich is a Python library for rich text and beautiful formatting in the
terminal.
dependent_to.name: py-rich

dependent_to.description:
Convert reStructured Text to PDF via ReportLab. The usual way of
creating PDF from reStructuredText is by going through LaTeX. This tool
provides an alternative by producing PDF directly using the ReportLab
library.
dependent_to.name: py-rst2pdf

dependent_to.description:
snoop is a powerful set of Python debugging tools. It's primarily meant
to be a more featureful and refined version of PySnooper. It also
includes its own version of icecream and some other nifty stuff.
dependent_to.name: py-snoop

dependent_to.description: Sphinx Documentation Generator.
dependent_to.name: py-sphinx

dependent_to.description: Sphinx directive to add unselectable prompt.
dependent_to.name: py-sphinx-prompt

dependent_to.description: Create tabbed content in Sphinx documentation when building HTML.
dependent_to.name: py-sphinx-tabs

dependent_to.description: Missing widgets and components for PyQt/PySide
dependent_to.name: py-superqt

dependent_to.description:
The TraitsUI project contains a toolkit-independent GUI abstraction
layer, which is used to support the "visualization" features of the
Traits package. Thus, you can write model in terms of the Traits API and
specify a GUI in terms of the primitives supplied by TraitsUI (views,
items, editors, etc.), and let TraitsUI and your selected toolkit and
back-end take care of the details of displaying them.
dependent_to.name: py-traitsui

dependent_to.description:
QGIS is a free and open-source cross-platform desktop geographic
information system application that supports viewing, editing, and
analysis of geospatial data.
dependent_to.name: qgis

dependent_to.description:
Workflow management system to create reproducible and scalable data
analyses.
dependent_to.name: snakemake

description: Pygments is a syntax highlighting package written in Python.
name: py-pygments

variants.description: Build systems supported by the package
variants.name: build_system
